C2 If you are philosophical in your reaction to something that is not satisfactory, you accept it calmly and without anger, understanding that failure and disappointment are a part of life.

relating to philosophy: Pragmatism is a philosophical theory.
To be philosophical about something, esp. something disappointing, is to accept it calmly: You just have to be philosophical about losing some games, because you can’t win them all. philosophically adverb us/ˌfɪl·əˈsɑf·ɪ·kli/
Even though we disagree philosophically, he's a good personal friend and I sincerely hope he will recover.
